questionListItems.title: Can a student who is allergic to grass/dust participate in the OBS Course?

answer.body: More information on the condition will be needed to ascertain if the student who is allergic to grass/dust can be supported for the Course. Parents should declare all medical conditions, including all types of allergies, in the Course Registration Form. The declaration is important to ensure that OBS can cater the necessary support and resources for students to participate in the MOE-OBS Challenge Programme safely.

questionListItems.title: Is a tetanus vaccination required for the MOE-OBS Challenge programme?

answer.body:
Yes, it is compulsory for students participating in the course to have valid tetanus immunisation. It is a basic form of protection against bacteria that may be introduced through cuts and scrapes that could be sustained as part of outdoor exposure.

Tetanus is valid for 10 years and most Singapore students would have received theirs under the national immunization programme in Primary 5.


If you wish to find out the actual date, parents can go to the Health Promotion Board website to access their child’s immunisation record (https://www.nir.hpb.gov.sg). Parents will need to have a SingPass to access this information. 

If your child did not have existing tetanus immunization, ensure to take the tetanus vaccination 2 months before the course to facilitate smooth enrolment.

questionListItems.title: Who is responsible for registering students for the MOE-OBS Challenge programme? Can students register themselves?

answer.body: Parents or legal guardians are responsible for registering their child/ward for the MOE-OBS Challenge programme. Students are not allowed to register themselves. Schools will be provided with customised form links to the Course Registration Form that parents or legal guardians will need to complete to register their child for the course. Parents/guardians will need to log in using their SingPass. Foreign students whose parents/guardians do not have SingPass should approach the teacher for assistance.

questionListItems.title: My child takes over-the-counter medication for his allergy. Can my child bring this medication?

answer.body:
If your child requires a particular brand of medication for his/her condition, ensure the information is provided in the registration form and have your child declare the medication to the instructor on Day 1.  The OBS instructor will verify that the medication is within the validity date and sufficient for the entire course.

 

OBS medical centres also carry over-the-counter medication for common ailment and if necessary, OBS nurses will assess the condition and can issue over-the-counter medication.

 

You may refer to this link for a list of OTC medication in OBS:

https://go.gov.sg/obsmedication

questionListItems.title: Does the student need to bring cash to OBS?

answer.body:
Students can bring any type of bag, which will be safe kept in their group’s assigned store during the expedition. Please note that there could be stairs and uneven terrain while getting to the campus.


For expedition purposes, OBS will issue suitable expedition packs for participants to use during the course/programme.

questionListItems.title: Is it necessary for my child to bring a small first aid kit for the course?

answer.body: No, it is not necessary for students to bring their own first aid kit for the course. The instructors will be equipped with a first aid kit and will provide treatment to manage any minor injuries if required. OBS has a well-equipped medical centre with trained medical staff who will provide medical attention and treatment if required.

questionListItems.title: Does my child need to bring along medicine for self-medication such as paracetamol?

answer.body:
There is no need for students to bring medicine for self-medication. During course, Instructors will provide treatment for students when they fall ill or get injured. Instructors carry basic over-the-counter medication such as painkillers for treatment in the outfield. Also, the OBS medical centres carry over-the-counter medication for common ailment and OBS nurses will assess the condition and issue over-the-counter medication if required.


However, if your child requires prescribed medication for his/her medical condition, ensure the information is provided in the registration form and have your child declare the medication to the instructor. The OBS instructor will verify that the medication is prescribed to his/her name/condition, within the validity date and sufficient for the day.

questionListItems.title: What is the ratio of Instructor to students?

answer.body: There will be 1 Instructor to a maximum of 14 students.

questionListItems.title: As the course is inter-school mixing, what is the student ratio per school in a group?

answer.body: Each group will have maximum of 14 students, with a mix of students from 3 to 5 schools in a group. This is to encourage social mixing and allow the students to make new friends.

questionListItems.title: If my child needs to take time-off or leave earlier from the course, is he/she allowed to do so?

answer.body: We do not encourage your child to take time off or leave the course early as it may affect his/her learning experience. Please check with the school before making any arrangements.
